title: How to See Which YouTube Channels You Subscribe To

steps.title: Open the YouTube app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. It's the icon with a red rectangle containing a white sideways triangle. If you don't have the YouTube app, you can download it for iPhone and iPad in the App Store or for Android in the Google Play Store . You can also use YouTube in a web browser at m.youtube.com.

steps.title: Tap the Subscriptions tab.
steps.content: Tap the Subscriptions tab. It's at the bottom of the screen. This displays your Subscriptions page.

steps.title: Tap All to view all of your subscriptions.
steps.content: Tap All to view all of your subscriptions. It's in the upper-right area of the screen. This displays a list of all the YouTube channels you're subscribed to. [1] X Research source If a channel has new content since the last time you checked it out, you'll see a blue dot next to its name. By default, your subscriptions are sorted in "Most relevant" order. To see an alphabetical list of who you follow, tap Most relevant at the top-left, then tap A-Z or New activity .

steps.title: Manage your subscriptions (optional).
steps.content: Manage your subscriptions (optional). If you want to manage notifications for channels you subscribe to or unsubscribe from a channel, tap the bell icon to the right of the subscription you want to change. Keep in mind that you must have YouTube notifications enabled in your device settings first. Select All to be notified each time this YouTube channel shares new content. Select Personalized to allow the YouTube app to choose when to notify you about this channel's newest content. Select None to stop being notified about this channel. Tap Unsubscribe to stop following this channel. If you are receiving notifications for a YouTube channel, its corresponding bell icon will be filled in. Tap the bell icon to toggle notifications on or off for that channel.

steps.title: Go to YouTube in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to YouTube in a web browser. If you're not already signed in to your account, click Sign in at the top-right corner to sign in now. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Subscriptions tab.
steps.content: Click the Subscriptions tab. It's in the left panel of icons. This displays a page that shows you the latest updates from YouTube channels you are subscribed to. If you don't see this button, click â˜° to expand the side panel.

steps.title: Click Manage.
steps.content: Click Manage . It's at the top-right corner of the Subscriptions page. Now you'll see an alphabetized list of all channels you've subscribed to.

steps.title: Manage your subscriptions (optional).
steps.content: Manage your subscriptions (optional). The Manage page is where you can adjust your notification preferences and unsubscribe from channels you no longer want to follow. If you are receiving notifications for a channel, its corresponding bell icon will be filled in. Click the bell icon to toggle notifications on or off for that channel. To unsubscribe from a YouTube channel, click Subscribed to the right of the channel's name, and then click Unsubscribe to confirm.

steps.title: How do I subscribe to a YouTube channel?
steps.content: How do I subscribe to a YouTube channel? To subscribe to a YouTube channel, select the Subscribe button underneath a video or on their profile page.

steps.title: How do I find channels to subscribe to?
steps.content: How do I find channels to subscribe to? To find new channels you may be interested in, you can browse your home feed. Select a tag to view different categories, or use the search field to enter topics you're interested in.

steps.title: How do I change my notification settings?
steps.content: How do I change my notification settings? To change your notification settings for certain channels, open your Subscriptions list. Select the bell icon next to the user's name to adjust their notification settings.

steps.title: Is there a YouTube subscription limit?
steps.content: Is there a YouTube subscription limit? You can subscribe to 75 channels per day. If you exceed this amount, you'll see the error message: "Too many subscriptions". Generally, you can subscribe to 2,000 channels at a maximum. However, your exact limits may change depending on how long your account has existed or how many subscribers you have.

steps.title: What's the difference between Notifications and Subscriptions Feed?
steps.content: What's the difference between Notifications and Subscriptions Feed? Your Subscriptions Feed shows recent uploads from channels you're subscribed to. This is what you see on the mobile app and website. Notifications can be sent to your email, mobile device, and/or YouTube inbox. These notifications can include activity from other channels, replies, shares, and more.

steps.title: How do you see your subscribers on YouTube?
steps.content: How do you see your subscribers on YouTube? To see who subscribed to you on YouTube, log into YouTube Studio . On your dashboard, locate the Recent subscribers card, and then select See all . [3] X Research source You can also sort the list by time frame. Keep in mind that some subscribers may not be shown if they chose to keep subscriptions private.
